Package semplate

Class SemanticTemplateWriter

java.lang.Object
semplate.SemanticTemplateWriter
Direct Known Subclasses:
SemanticWriter
public class SemanticTemplateWriter
extends java.lang.Object
Writes a semantically annotated markdown file using a data object containing the data and a template file.

This class is never directly instantiated by clients. Instead the factory methods in SemanticWriter are used: 

 
      SemanticWriter.with(dataObject).usingTemplate(templateFilePath).write(outputFilePath);

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected semplate.Delimiter commentDelimiter
    The delimiters used for comments in the mark down file

    The object containing the data for the output file
    protected semplate.Delimiters delimiters
    Any delimiters used around data in the output file

  • Method Details

    • write

      public void write​(java.nio.file.Path outputFile) throws WriteException
      Generates a semantically annotated markdown file from a template.
      Parameters:
      outputFile - Path specifying the markdown file to be generated
      Throws:
      WriteException - if the markdown file could no be created for some cause.

    • assembleSemanticBlock

      protected java.lang.StringBuilder assembleSemanticBlock​(java.lang.String textValueBlock)
      Reads in a text containing field specifications and creates a semantic block for it
      Parameters:
      textValueBlock - String containing field specifications
      Returns:
      The constructed semantic block

    • mapInlineFieldSpec

      protected java.lang.StringBuffer mapInlineFieldSpec​(java.lang.String s)
      Takes string of the form 
       
      S{{F}}E
      where S is the start delimiter, F is the field name and E is the end delimiter, and maps them to an inline field spec of the form: 
       
 {{F:pattern="S%sE"}}
      Parameters:
      s - The string to be mapped
      Returns:
      The inline field spec
